intro: Rosa × dumetorum subsp. platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved dog玫瑰, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and ovate, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to white, typically blooming in spring. Its horticultural value lies in its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil types. It is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ability to thrive in partial shade.
